intro: Rostraria parviflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rostraria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or violet. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Rostraria parviflora is often found in rocky or woodland habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
